title: The ratio of the present ages of P and Q is 3 : 4. Five years ago, the ratio of their ages was 5 : 7. Find their present ages? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let x and y be the present ages of P and Q respectively. Then x:y =3:4. Or x=3y/4. 5 years ago their ages were x-5 and y-5. Therefore (x-5)/y-5) = 5/7. Or 7 (x-5) =5 (y-5) Or 7x-35 =5y-25 Or 7x-5y =35-25 =10 Substituting the value of x above we get 7 (3y/4)-5y = 10 Or 21y/4-5y = 10 Or 21y - 20y = 40. Or y = 40. Substituting the value of y we have x = 3y/4 =3×40/4 = 30. Therefore the present ages of P and Q are 30 and 40 respectively.

Present age ratio of P , Q is given as 3 : 4 . So let us take the present age of P & Q as 3k & 4k (where k ratio constant) . Five years ago, the age of P , Q must have been (3k - 5) , (4k -5 ) . But it is given that (3k -5/4k -5) = (5/7) ==> k = 10 . Therefore the present age of P & Q are respectively 3k = 30 & 4k = 40 .
